titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. James Clark, C. Wilson, & Robert Land, Indictment
CWG6684

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
ROBERT CLARKE & CO., STATIONERS, 65 West Fourth Street, Cincinnati.
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
Against } Marion County Circuit Court.
James Clark, C. Wilson & RobErt Land

The Grand Jury of Marion County, in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, accuse James Clark C. Wilson Robert Land of the offense Crime of Grand Larceny committed as follows: The said James Clark C. Wilson & Robert Land on the 1st day of March 1865, in the County aforesaid, did feloniously Steal take and carry away Two Mules each of the value of One hundred and fifty dollars the personal property of William P, Beacon against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky.

L. H, Noble
Att'y for the Commonwealth.

Witness before the Jury:
W. P. Beacon &c
A Copy Attest
T. C. Jackson Clk

(Indictment)
No 124
The Commlth
vs } Grand Larceny
Jas Clark
C. Wilson
R. E. Land
A true bill
J. W. Tyler
Foreman of Grand Jury
Filed June 9th 1865
T. C. Jackson clk
